intro: Hieracium subpardalinum, commonly known as the lesser yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer months. The leaves are usually basal, with a rough texture and a slightly hairy surface.
